reference.title: index-see-also
reference.shortdesc: An <index-see-also> element within an <indexterm> redirects the reader to another index entry that the reader should reference in addition to the current one.

section.p: In addition to its "see also" redirection, an index-see-also functions as a pointwise indexterm, thereby typically generating a page reference as well as the "see also" indication.
It is not an error for there to be multiple index-see-also elements for a single index entry.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.p: The following example illustrates the use of an <index-see-also> redirection element within an <indexterm>:

This will typically generate a page reference to "Carp" and a redirection:
Carp, 56
see also Goldfish
